overview_of_class: Introduction to point, line and planar defects in crystalline solids: stress, strain and isotropic elasticity; atomic point defects; point defect thermodynamics; dislocations; grain boundary structure.
name: Imperfections in Materials
title: MEAS MAT_SCI 404-0-20 Imperfections in Materials

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Introduction to point, line and planar defects in crystalline solids: stress, strain and isotropic elasticity; atomic point defects; point defect thermodynamics; dislocations; grain boundary structure.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Basic Materials Science to at least the level of MSE 301, 316-1 and 316-2 or equivalent, in particular:

Basic crystallography of fcc and bcc crystals, e.g. packing, directions, planes.
Basic concepts of structure in metals and ceramic crystals.
Basics of dislocations, e.g Burger's vectors, glide plane, partial and full dislocations.
Basics of microstructure, e.g. grains and grain boundaries.
Elements of statistical thermodynamics, in particular Boltzmann distribution, Fermi-Dirac statistics, Phonon Entropy.
Basic concepts of elasticity, e.g. Hooke's Law, Shear and Bulk Modulus.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures will be the main part of the exposition. Students are expected and encouraged to ask questions and participate in discussions during the class. The solution of the problems is an essential part of this course.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Grading: Examination number 1 45%
Examination number 2 45%
Homework 10%

Homework: Homework assignments are due at 6 pm one week from the day they are assigned, unless noted otherwise.
